title: What is the ultimate goal of the shaman in De Martino's perspective of magic and initiation?
first_phrase: In the last part (200 tokens) of this text, the author reflects on De Martino's concept of the shaman as the hero who navigates the liminal space between chaos and order. Through various rituals, including trance, the shaman delves into the supernatural world and emerges with a newfound sense of self. The author clarifies that De Martino's ideas about initiation and spiritual integration apply equally to the past and present, and that they transcend any particular historical period or culture.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the path to stopping the lotion's effects is to deliberately push oneself to the limits of consciousness and initiate a special calling to dissolve the ego, only to recreate it in a second birth. The task of becoming a higher person in today's world is just as challenging as it was in the "magical world" of De Martino. Therefore, it is essential to recognize that the study of magic must be approached from the perspective of contemporary consciousness, rather than from a purely historical standpoint, as only fragments of its essence remain in modern society.
